授業目的: This is a hands-on, student-presentation class. Web and Society expands a wide variety of definitions. In this class, we will be exploring the evolution of our digital society from the human-computer-human interactions point of view as opposed to the most common computer-computer perspective. We will explore up-to-date, wave-maker technologies, services, and companies that provide non-real-time social interactions, such as Twitter, Path, Mixi, Facebook, Wii, Xbox, iPhone, iPad, Google Phone XBox Kinect, Oculus, HTC Vive, Magic Leap, Microsoft Hololens and much, much more. We will also explore more recent technologies that support real-time social interactions, such as e-sports, social networking systems (Instagram, TikTok), false news, deep fakes, and social communities such as Second Life.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
1) Understand the th evolution of our digital society from the human-computer-human interactions point of view
2) Understand the impact of current technologies in our society
3) Understand and predict what and how current technologies might change our lives in the near future
4) Understand who are the shakers and movers that are making the greatest contribution to our digital society

学生発表、個人及びチーム・プロジェクトを含む。
原則的に対面授業形式ですが、オンライン授業の許可を得ている学生のために、同時双方向型オンラインで授業します。全ての授業はZoomにて収録し、Lunaサイトで後からも見ることができます。

Requires student presentations and individual and team projects.
In essence, the class format is face-to-face, but for students who have permission for online classes, the class will be taught in a simultaneous interactive online format. All classes are recorded via Zoom and can be viewed later on the Luna site.
